text:
We can use .shtml in apache 1.3.29,and include many .inc file.but sometimes 
when some .inc file  not found in <header></header> tag,the whole shtml page 
can not be displayed in the browser,the error is "the page is not found".And 
use wget to get it the error info is "HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 
End of file while parsing headers. Retrying.",if I create a new but empty .inc 
file(filename=missing .inc file),the shtml page can display normallly. 
But another server using 1.3.28,is the same env,and missing the same .inc file 
between <header></header> tag,but the .shtml page can ignore this error the 
display the page.
My question is :How can I make apache ignore this error,and display the shtml 
page normally?
creator: arnoldguo@21cn.com

text:
Hmm. Can you be more specific? What happens with the server, when the error
occurs? What's in the error log? Does the server crash or the like? Please try
to get the errorneous page manually (with netcat or telnet) and tell us, what's
delivered exactly. Does such a request get logged into the access log?

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de
arnoldguo@21cn.com
text:
There is the following error log:
[error] [client 1.1.1.1] File does not exist: /xx/xx/xx.inc
[Wed XXX 31 111 2003] [error] [client 1.1.1.1] unable to 
include "/xx/xx/xx.inc" in parsed file /xx/xx/sss.shtml

I think missing include file is normal in complicate shtml,but it is strange 
that my apache sometime can not display this shtml page,why?

More info:
1.When this error happen,the server is ok,html can be displayed normally,and i 
restart apache,shtml can not be displayed until i make a new but empty included 
file(the file that report missing in errorlog).
creator: arnoldguo@21cn.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
The log entry looks ok. What does the access log entry of the request say? Is
there one? (If not, it's likely, that apache crashed).
However, Apache does never display shtml files, but the client shows the
resulting output. I'm still missing a description, what is actually sent to the
client.

Thanks for further information.

I think this is the problem about error log,when i clear my server's errorlog 
file,the shtml page can be displayed even if some include file missing.So i 
think maybe apache 1.3.29 can work normally only if it can write error info to 
the log?(1.3.28 is not work like this?i don't know).So I change apache's 
Loglevel to ignore this missing file error and it seems work fine.Maybe this is 
another bug in 1.3.29?
